title: Thepla brand marketing + catalog website (multi-page, sliders, cart, FAQ, contact)

requirements.summary: Build a responsive multi-page site with routes/pages for Home, Categories, Cart, Notifications, Account, FAQ, and Contact, with working navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: App loads with working navigation to: Home, Categories, Cart, Notifications, Account, FAQ, Contact.
Pages render well on mobile and desktop (no horizontal overflow; readable typography).

file_operations.description: Create the main app shell with React Router routes for Home, Categories, Cart, Notifications, Account, FAQ, and Contact, and wire shared layout (header + bottom nav + content padding).
Create Home page with required narrative sections and cohesive layout blocks.
Create Categories page and wire it to the router.
Create Cart page and wire it to the router.
Create Notifications placeholder page and wire it to the router.
Create Account placeholder page and wire it to the router.
Create FAQ page and wire it to the router.
Create Contact page and wire it to the router.

requirements.summary: Add an editable branding header with in-UI brand name and logo placeholders, editable for the current session without backend.
acceptanceCriteria: Header shows a logo placeholder and brand name placeholder by default.
User can edit brand name text in the UI and see it reflected across the site during the session.
User can upload/select a logo image in the UI and see it in the header during the session (no backend required).

file_operations.description: Create a Brand context/provider to store brand name and selected logo (object URL) in memory for the session and expose setters for site-wide use.
Create the header branding UI with visible placeholders when unset, an editable brand name control, and a logo file picker that updates the BrandProvider state.
Wrap the app layout with BrandProvider and render HeaderBranding across all pages so branding changes reflect site-wide during the session.

requirements.summary: Add a visually prominent Brand Story section on Home using the provided narrative text verbatim with readable paragraph formatting.
acceptanceCriteria: Brand Story section appears on Home and contains the full provided story text, formatted into readable paragraphs.
Text is presented in English and is not truncated.

file_operations.description: Add a prominent "Brand Story" section on Home and include the full provided narrative text verbatim, formatted into readable paragraphs (no truncation).
Create global styles (Tailwind base + CSS variables) and ensure typography defaults support readable long-form paragraphs for the Brand Story section.

requirements.summary: Add a Home section (English title) explaining the Griha Mahila Udyog women-from-home empowerment model aligned with brand mission.
acceptanceCriteria: Section is present on Home and written in English.
Content clearly explains the at-home women empowerment model and ties back to the brand mission.

file_operations.description: Add a dedicated Home section with an English title explaining the Griha Mahila Udyog model (women working from home, financial independence) and connect it to the brand mission/tone.

requirements.summary: Implement Categories view with three category carousels showing the specified thepla products, pack sizes, and ₹ pricing (including a range for Methi Thepla).
acceptanceCriteria: Categories are displayed exactly as: Long Duration (3 Months), Short Duration (1 Day), Diet Conscious.
Each category renders products in a horizontal slider/carousel that can be navigated on mobile (swipe/scroll) and desktop (buttons or scroll).
Each product card shows: unbranded realistic product image, product name, pack size text, and price using ₹.
Methi Thepla price is displayed as a range (₹45–₹50) rather than a single value.

file_operations.description: Create hardcoded product data for thepla categories (names, pack size labels, ₹ prices including range for Methi Thepla) and map each item to the required generated image asset paths under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Create a reusable ProductCard that renders product image, name, pack size, and price formatting with the ₹ symbol (supporting a displayed range when provided).
Create a horizontally scrollable carousel/slider component supporting touch scrolling on mobile and button/scroll controls on desktop for category product browsing.
Render the three required categories exactly by name and display each category's products using ProductCarousel and ProductCard.
Ensure Categories page route and navigation wiring are present so the Categories carousels are reachable.

requirements.summary: Add an Other Products slider with specified items, realistic unbranded images, optional ₹ pricing, (500g) labels, and per-item session quantity controls.
acceptanceCriteria: Other Products section uses a horizontal slider/carousel on mobile and desktop.
Items with prices show ₹95 and ₹110 respectively; items without prices do not show a fake price.
Each item shows its (500g) pack size label.
Each item provides a quantity control (e.g., stepper) that changes the selected quantity for cart actions during the session.

file_operations.description: Add Other Products items (Lime, Mango with ₹ prices; Chilli, Awla, Carrot, Chunda, Thecha without prices) with (500g) pack size labels and required generated image asset paths under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Add an optional per-item quantity control (session state) for "Other Products" cards and ensure items without prices do not render a fake price label.
Add an "Other Products" section using ProductCarousel and ProductCard, ensuring quantity selection influences add-to-cart actions for the session.

requirements.summary: Implement a persistent local cart: add from product cards, update quantities, remove items, and compute line totals and grand total in ₹.
acceptanceCriteria: Add-to-cart action exists on product cards.
Cart page lists added items with quantity controls and remove option.
Grand total updates correctly when quantities change.
Cart contents persist across page refresh using local storage (or equivalent browser storage).

file_operations.description: Create a Cart context/provider with add/remove/update quantity actions, line total and grand total computation in ₹, and localStorage persistence across refresh.
Add an Add-to-Cart action that uses CartProvider to add items from both thepla and other-product carousels (respecting selected quantity for other products).
Implement cart UI listing items with quantity controls, remove actions, line totals, and a ₹ grand total; bind to CartProvider state so totals update live.
Wrap the app with CartProvider so cart state is available across pages and persists via browser storage.

requirements.summary: Add a fixed bottom navigation bar on mobile with Home, Categories, Cart, Notification, Account; active state and content padding to avoid overlap.
acceptanceCriteria: Bottom nav is fixed at the bottom on mobile and does not overlap primary content (content has proper padding).
Tapping each nav item navigates to the correct page.
Current page is visually indicated as active.

file_operations.description: Create a fixed mobile bottom navigation component with items: Home, Categories, Cart, Notification, Account; include active-state styling based on current route.
Wire BottomNav into the shared layout and ensure the main content area has bottom padding so the fixed nav does not overlap content.
Adjust global layout helpers (e.g., safe-area and spacing defaults) to support a fixed bottom nav without horizontal overflow.

requirements.summary: Provide non-empty themed placeholder pages for Notifications and Account (no auth) so navigation destinations are complete.
acceptanceCriteria: Notifications page renders a non-empty placeholder layout (English).
Account page renders a non-empty placeholder layout (English).
No dead links/routes for these pages.

file_operations.description: Implement a themed, non-empty Notifications placeholder layout in English (no real-time notifications required).
Implement a themed, non-empty Account placeholder layout in English (no authentication required).
Ensure routes and navigation destinations for Notifications and Account are registered and reachable.

requirements.summary: Create an English FAQ page with an accordion UI covering shelf life, storage, ingredients/no preservatives, delivery/ordering, and women-led production.
acceptanceCriteria: FAQ page exists and is reachable from navigation (header menu, footer, or bottom nav via Account/More).
FAQs are displayed in an accordion where items expand/collapse.
All FAQ text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create a lightweight accordion component for FAQs (expand/collapse behavior and accessible button semantics).
Add FAQ content in English relevant to the brand (shelf life, storage, ingredients/no preservatives, delivery/ordering, women-led production) and render it using FaqAccordion.
Ensure FAQ route is registered and reachable via site navigation (e.g., from header links and/or Contact/Account area).

requirements.summary: Add a Contact page showing phone number and location, plus editable placeholders for Email ID and Instagram handle (no backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Contact info displays phone number exactly: 9785674345.
Location displays exactly: Mulund East.
Email and Instagram are shown as placeholders/fields that the user can fill in (no backend required).

file_operations.description: Render Contact info with phone number 9785674345 and location Mulund East, plus input fields/placeholders for Email ID and Instagram handle stored in local component state (no backend).
Ensure Contact route is registered and linked from navigation so the Contact page is reachable.

requirements.summary: Structure the site with sections inspired by a legacy/women-empowerment/quality-trust product-catalog flow without copying or mentioning Lijjat Papad.
acceptanceCriteria: Site layout includes clear sections for legacy/story, women empowerment, and quality/trust alongside product catalog, FAQ, and contact.
No mention of Lijjat Papad as the brand of this site, and no copied text that appears to be from that site.

file_operations.description: Organize Home into clear sections (legacy/story, women empowerment, quality/trust) and include strong calls-to-action linking to Categories, FAQ, and Contact—without mentioning Lijjat Papad or copying external text.
Add simple header navigation links to key pages (e.g., Categories, FAQ, Contact) to support the cohesive marketing-site structure while keeping the site branded as Thepla (not Lijjat Papad).

requirements.summary: Create and apply a cohesive warm, appetizing visual theme (no blue/purple primary) across buttons, headings, cards, and navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across pages (buttons, headings, cards, nav).
Primary palette is not blue/purple.
UI looks like a food brand site (warm neutrals/spice tones, tasteful typography).

file_operations.description: Define warm/spice-toned CSS variables for the Tailwind/shadcn color tokens (primary/secondary/accent/background/foreground), set typography defaults, and ensure consistent spacing; avoid blue/purple as primary.
Tune Tailwind theme extensions as needed to support the chosen warm palette and consistent component styling (no blue/purple as primary).
Apply consistent themed styling (card, buttons, text hierarchy) aligned with the warm food-brand theme.
Apply consistent themed styling and clear active-state indication aligned with the warm food-brand theme.

requirements.summary: Add required generated product images under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them on product cards as realistic, unbranded static assets.
acceptanceCriteria: All product cards display an image loaded from frontend/public/assets/generated.
Images are realistic and contain no visible brand text/logos.
No images are served from the backend canister.
